title: Trinny Woodall drops C-bomb on LIVE TV when describing What Not To Wear co-host Susannah Constantin
text:
Trinny Woodall caused a stir when she appeared on Australia's The Sunday Project program on Sunday evening.

The 55-year-old dropped the C-word by accident - on live television - when describing her What Not To Wear co-host, Susannah Constantin, 57.

Asked if the women were still good friends, Trinny confirmed that they were - and said they have some naughty nicknames for one another.

'I'm sorry I meant to leave some of that out!' Trinny Woodall (pictured) was left blushing after accidentally dropping the C-bomb on Australia's The Sunday Project on Sunday evening

'I speak to her once every 10 days. She's writing a second book,' Trinny said brightly, before being asked if the pair, 'still grab each other on the b**bs'.

She began: 'No. But we call each other very rude words. I mean, I'll text her and go...'

The fashionista then quickly spelled out the swear word, 'c**ty' letter by letter.

Oops! The 55-year-old dropped the C-word by accident - on live television - when describing her What Not To Wear co-host, Susannah Constantin, 57 (pictured left)

A moment later, Trinny realised what she had done, her hand flying up to her mouth and her face flushing with embarrassment.

"Oh I'm sorry. I meant to leave some of that out!' she gasped as the audience burst into laughter.

Host Tommy Little replied jokingly: 'You can't spell 'country' to save yourself, Trinny. You accidentally left out a few of the letters!'

Oops! Asked if the women were still good friends, Trinny confirmed they were - and have naughty nicknames for one another. 'We call each other very rude words. I mean, I'll text her and go...' The fashionista then quickly spelled out the swear word 'c**ty' letter by letter

Oh dear! A moment later, Trinny realised what she had done, her hand flying up to her mouth and her face flushing with embarrassment. "Oh I'm sorry. I meant to leave some of that out!' she gasped as the audience burst into laughter

The panel of hosts quickly diverted the talk back to talk of fashion, with the British media personality complimenting Tommy's tie.

Trinny is in town to take part in the Trinny Tribe Australia events.

She is best known for the English fashion makeover show What Not To Wear but has also launched her own makeup line, Trinny London.
description: Trinny Woodall caused a stir when she appeared on Australia's The Sunday Project program on Sunday evening.
authors: Marta Jary For Daily Mail Australia
